page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: { Week of 6th July, 1985 Recorded telephone message to farmers and growers, given by the East of Scotland College og Agriculture. { WINTER BARLEY-}Problems should now all be past. Consideration should now be given to new varieties which might be grown next year. { WINTER WHEAT}-Any fungicide needed should be applied now, particularly against sooty mould. { SPRING BARLEY}- Early varieties are now headed. For later varieties it is still worth spraying.{ { POTATOES }-A blight warning is still in force. Seed crops are showing damage from weedkiller sprays. It is brought to your notice that no weedkiller is entirely safe. { CATTLE}-Cattle at grass are now due for worming. The college will be pleased to advise about drenches.
